growth.water: Keep soil moist but not soggy

diseases.Powdery Mildew: White fungus on leaves. Solution: Improve airflow, apply fungicide.
diseases.Root Rot: Overwatering causes brown roots. Solution: Repot with fresh soil, reduce watering.

African Violet (Saintpaulia ionantha).notes: Avoid wetting leaves to prevent rot.

growth.water: Water every 2-3 weeks, allow soil to dry
growth.fertilizer: Once a month in growing season

diseases.Root Rot: From overwatering. Solution: Dry soil, repot.
diseases.Leaf Spot: Fungal spots. Solution: Remove infected leaves, use neem oil.

Aloe Vera.notes: Do not overwater, prone to root rot.

diseases.Bacterial Blight: Yellowing leaves with spots. Solution: Remove infected leaves, apply copper fungicide.
diseases.Root Rot: Waterlogging issue. Solution: Improve drainage, repot.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Brown patches. Solution: Apply fungicide, avoid overhead watering.
diseases.Bud Rot: Rotting crown. Solution: Cut infected part, improve airflow.

Areca Palm (Dypsis lutescens).notes: Wipe leaves to avoid dust blocking pores.

diseases.Root Rot: Due to overwatering. Solution: Repot and reduce watering.
diseases.Rust: Orange fungal spores. Solution: Use fungicide spray.

diseases.Powdery Mildew: White coating on leaves. Solution: Neem oil spray.
diseases.Botrytis: Gray mold on flowers. Solution: Improve ventilation, fungicide.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Fungal infection. Solution: Remove infected leaves, fungicide spray.
diseases.Root Rot: Caused by soggy soil. Solution: Repot and improve drainage.

growth.water: Keep soil moist but not soggy

diseases.Crown Rot: Caused by water in leaf center. Solution: Avoid overhead watering.

Birds Nest Fern (Asplenium nidus).notes: Do not water directly into the crown.

diseases.Root Rot: Excess water causes decay. Solution: Repot with dry soil.
diseases.Leaf Blight: Brown, crispy fronds. Solution: Increase humidity.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Fungal/bacterial spots. Solution: Neem oil spray.
diseases.Root Rot: Due to soggy soil. Solution: Repot in drier mix.

Calathea.notes: Avoid tap water, use filtered water.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Brown/black spots. Solution: Remove affected leaves, use fungicide.
diseases.Root Rot: Overwatering issue. Solution: Improve drainage.

growth.water: Water weekly, allow soil to dry slightly

diseases.Root Rot: Yellow leaves, mushy roots. Solution: Repot, reduce watering.
diseases.Leaf Curl: Caused by pests or stress. Solution: Neem oil, proper care.

Chinese Money Plant (Pilea peperomioides.notes: Rotate pot weekly for even growth.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Yellow/brown spots. Solution: Neem oil, remove leaves.
diseases.Root Rot: Caused by soggy soil. Solution: Repot in well-drained mix.

growth.water: Water when soil is dry halfway

diseases.Root Rot: From overwatering. Solution: Repot with drier soil.
diseases.Botrytis: Gray mold on stems. Solution: Improve ventilation, fungicide.

Christmas Cactus (Schlumbergera bridgesi.notes: Promote flowering by reducing water before blooming.

diseases.Powdery Mildew: White coating. Solution: Neem oil spray.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Causes brown patches. Solution: Remove affected leaves.
diseases.Root Rot: Waterlogged soil issue. Solution: Repot in airy soil.

growth.water: Water during active growth, dry in dormancy

diseases.Basal Rot: Bulb rot. Solution: Use fungicide, plant in dry soil.
diseases.Narcissus Smoulder: Gray mold. Solution: Remove infected plants.

Daffodils (Narcissus spp.).notes: Do not cut leaves until they yellow naturally.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Brown patches. Solution: Neem oil spray.
diseases.Root Rot: Caused by overwatering. Solution: Repot, reduce watering.

Dracaena.notes: Sensitive to fluoride in tap water.

diseases.Bacterial Leaf Spot: Yellow/brown spots. Solution: Remove leaves, copper spray.
diseases.Root Rot: Soggy soil issue. Solution: Repot in fresh mix.

Dumb Cane (Dieffenbachia spp.).notes: Toxic if ingested, keep away from pets.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Dark lesions on leaves. Solution: Use fungicide.
diseases.Root Rot: Due to soggy soil. Solution: Improve drainage.

growth.fertilizer: Balanced fertilizer every 2 weeks in summer

diseases.Spider Mites: Causes leaf yellowing. Solution: Neem oil spray.
diseases.Leaf Spot: Brown patches. Solution: Remove leaves, apply fungicide.

English Ivy (Hedera helix).notes: Can trail or climb; prune regularly.

growth.water: Water during growth, reduce after flowering

diseases.Gray Mold: Fuzzy mold on flowers. Solution: Improve airflow, fungicide.
diseases.Basal Rot: Bulb rot. Solution: Discard infected bulbs.

diseases.Powdery Mildew: White powder on leaves. Solution: Neem oil.
diseases.Root Rot: Caused by waterlogging. Solution: Repot with airy soil.

growth.water: Water deeply, allow soil to dry

diseases.Root Rot: Due to overwatering. Solution: Let soil dry completely.
diseases.Mealybugs: White cottony pests. Solution: Alcohol swab, neem oil.

Jade plant (Crassula ovata).notes: Popular succulent, considered a good luck plant.

diseases.Root Rot: Avoid excess watering. Solution: Repot with dry soil.

diseases.Botrytis Blight: Spots on leaves. Solution: Fungicide, improve airflow.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Dark patches. Solution: Remove leaves, apply fungicide.
diseases.Gray Mold: Mold on flowers. Solution: Better airflow, fungicide.

Lily of the valley (Convallaria majalis).notes: Fragrant white bells, toxic if ingested.

growth.water: Water weekly, let soil dry slightly

diseases.Root Rot: Caused by soggy soil. Solution: Repot, less water.

Money Tree (Pachira aquatica).notes: Often braided, considered a lucky plant.

diseases.Root Rot: Due to excess water. Solution: Repot with drier soil.
diseases.Leaf Spot: Dark lesions. Solution: Neem oil spray.

Monstera Deliciosa (Monstera deliciosa).notes: Known as Swiss Cheese Plant due to leaf holes.

growth.water: Water weekly, allow roots to dry

diseases.Root Rot: Waterlogged roots. Solution: Use well-draining medium.
diseases.Black Rot: Dark, mushy leaves. Solution: Remove infected parts, fungicide.

diseases.Spider Mites: Causes yellowing. Solution: Neem oil, increase humidity.
diseases.Root Rot: Overwatering issue. Solution: Repot in well-draining soil.

diseases.Fungal Leaf Spot: Dark spots. Solution: Neem oil, remove infected leaves.

Peace lily.notes: Produces white blooms; good indoor air purifier.

growth.water: Keep soil moist but not soggy

diseases.Root Rot: Caused by soggy soil. Solution: Improve drainage.

Poinsettia (Euphorbia pulcherrima).notes: Famous holiday plant with red bracts.

diseases.Root Rot: Caused by overwatering. Solution: Allow soil to dry.
diseases.Aphids: Sticky leaves. Solution: Neem oil or insecticidal soap.

diseases.Stem Rot: Overwatering. Solution: Reduce watering, improve drainage.
diseases.Leaf Browning: Low humidity. Solution: Mist leaves occasionally.

Ponytail Palm (Beaucarnea recurvata).notes: Not a true palm; stores water in bulbous trunk.

diseases.Root Rot: Due to overwatering. Solution: Let soil dry out.
diseases.Mealybugs: White pests. Solution: Alcohol swab, neem oil spray.

Pothos (Ivy arum).notes: Very hardy, ideal beginner indoor plant.

growth.water: Keep soil moist but not soggy

diseases.Leaf Curling: Caused by low humidity. Solution: Mist regularly.
diseases.Root Rot: Overwatering issue. Solution: Repot with airy soil.

Prayer Plant (Maranta leuconeura).notes: Folds leaves upward at night like praying hands.

diseases.Leaf Spot: Fungal patches. Solution: Remove leaves, use fungicide.
diseases.Brown Tips: Caused by hard water. Solution: Use distilled water.

growth.water: Allow topsoil to dry before watering

diseases.Leaf Drop: Caused by sudden light changes. Solution: Keep stable light.
diseases.Mealybugs: Solution: Neem oil or alcohol swab.

diseases.Cycad Scale: White spots on leaves. Solution: Neem oil spray.
diseases.Root Rot: Excess water. Solution: Improve drainage.

diseases.Leaf Drop: Caused by low light or overwatering. Solution: Improve light, adjust watering.
diseases.Spider Mites: Causes speckled leaves. Solution: Neem oil spray.

Schefflera.notes: Also called umbrella plant; very hardy.

diseases.Root Rot: Overwatering problem. Solution: Use well-draining soil.
diseases.Mealybugs: White fuzzy pests. Solution: Alcohol swab or neem oil.

Snake plant (Sanseviera).notes: Excellent air purifier; nearly indestructible plant.

growth.water: Keep soil moist but not soggy

diseases.Leaf Browning: Caused by direct sunlight. Solution: Move to indirect light.

Tradescantia.notes: Colorful trailing plant; easy to propagate.

growth.water: Water during active growth; reduce after blooming

diseases.Tulip Fire: Fungal disease causing spots. Solution: Remove infected bulbs.
diseases.Gray Mold: Caused by humidity. Solution: Improve airflow.

growth.fertilizer: Do not fertilize; feeds on insects

diseases.Blackened Traps: Overfeeding or old traps. Solution: Remove dead traps.
diseases.Fungal Infections: High humidity issue. Solution: Increase airflow.

growth.water: Water when soil is completely dry

diseases.Root Rot: Overwatering. Solution: Ensure dry soil between watering.

diseases.Yellow Leaves: Overwatering. Solution: Allow soil to dry out.
diseases.Root Rot: Poor drainage issue. Solution: Repot with gritty mix.

ZZ Plant (Zamioculcas zamiifolia).notes: Very hardy indoor plant; tolerant of neglect.
